biography.title: Biography
biography.p1: I was born in Mendoza in 1959.
biography.p2: Painting came early, not as an aesthetic choice, but as a way of being in the world.
biography.p3: At sixteen I took a brush with my mouth and understood that the body always finds alternative ways to say what it needs to say.
biography.p4: I did not study painting in academies. I studied rhythm.
biography.p5: The time it takes for the gesture, the breath that accompanies the stroke, the silence that surrounds each decision.
biography.p6: I paint landscapes, flowers, still lifes. I paint what does not impose itself.
biography.p7: For decades I have been part of the Association of Mouth and Foot Painting Artists and represent Argentina as a delegate.
biography.p8: Not as a symbol. As an artist.

howipaint.title: How I Paint
howipaint.p1: The brush rests in the mouth.
howipaint.p2:
The neck guides.
The head corrects.
howipaint.p4: Painting this way is not a feat.
howipaint.p5:
It is a craft learned
over time.

association.title: World Association
association.p1: Alberto Álvarez is a full member of the Association of Mouth and Foot Painting Artists (VDMFK), based in Europe.
association.p2: Since 2019 he has served as the Argentine delegate to this institution.
association.p3: The Association brings together artists from more than 60 countries and promotes art as a profession.

posts.title: The art of the everyday
posts.content: Today I painted a broken cup. It reminded me that even the simplest things have stories to tell.

posts.title: Light and shadow
posts.content: The afternoon light enters through the window and transforms everything. It is a reminder that beauty is in the details.

posts.title: The silence of the studio
posts.content: The silence in my studio is not empty, it is full of possibilities. Each brushstroke is a dialogue with the canvas.

articles.title: “The 'ANDINO' exhibition by Alberto Alvarez opens at the Port”
articles.desc: Article announcing the opening of the Andino exhibition at the Auditorium Theater in Mar del Plata. Andean landscapes painted in oil using the brush held in the mouth are exhibited, in homage to the landscapes of Mendoza, the artist's homeland. It is highlighted that Álvarez is a full member of the World Association of Mouth and Foot Painting Artists (VDMFK), Argentine delegate since 2019, and his most important awards are reviewed: National Biennial Prize A.L.P.I. (1977) and World Peace Prize (2000).

articles.title: “Works painted with the brush in the mouth can be seen at the 'Andino' exhibition”
articles.desc: Chronicle of the same exhibition event. The Andino exhibition pays tribute to the nature of the Mendoza Andes through oil paintings made with the mouth. Álvarez's career and awards are recalled.
